## 🚀 **Monthly Viral Trend Tracker Workflow** This automation helps you track viral posts on **Quora** around specific topics (like *marketing* or *design*) every month. It scrapes trending content, extracts useful data (titles, URLs, stats), and saves it into a Google Sheet for later use — perfect for trend research, reporting, or content inspiration. --- ### 🧠 **SECTION 1: Trend Trigger & Scraper** > **Purpose:** Automate the scraping of viral content from Quora every month. #### ⏰ `Node 1: Monthly Trend Trigger` **🔗 Type:** Cron Scheduler **🧩 What it does:** This node is like your personal assistant — it **automatically starts the workflow on the 1st day of every month** without you lifting a finger. * 🗓 Trigger schedule: Monthly (e.g., `0 0 1 * *`) * 📈 Use Case: Keeps your trend tracking consistent and timely > 🧠 *Why it matters:* Instead of manually checking viral trends, this node ensures it’s **fully automated**, perfect for monthly reports or trend tracking dashboards. --- #### 🌐 `Node 2: Scrape Quora Trends (Bright Data)` **🔗 Type:** HTTP Request **🧩 What it does:** This node sends a **POST request to Bright Data** to scrape trending Quora results for a given topic (like `"https://www.quora.com/search?q=marketing"`). * 🔒 Uses **Bright Data Web Unlocker** to bypass restrictions * 🧠 Intelligent scraping with full HTML + rendering * 🔍 Targets specific search terms (e.g., `marketing`, `UX`, `AI in marketing`) > 💡 *Why it matters:* You can collect **real trending content** from Quora without opening your browser. Bright Data handles the hard stuff like JavaScript, proxies, and blocks. --- ### 🧾 **SECTION 2: Extract & Save Insights** > **Purpose:** Process the scraped data and store it in a usable format (Google Sheets). #### 🧱 `Node 3: Extract Post Titles & Stats` **🔗 Type:** HTML Extract **🧩 What it does:** Takes the raw HTML from Quora and pulls out the meaningful information you care about: * 📝 Question titles or post headlines * 🔗 URLs * 👍 Vote count or engagement * 🧑 Author or answer snippet (if desired) You use **CSS Selectors or XPath** to tell n8n what to extract. For example: ```css a.q-box.qu-mb--tiny → Post links div.q-relative → Snippets or text ``` > 🧠 *Why it matters:* This is where raw data becomes structured. You’re now transforming messy HTML into useful, clean trend info. --- #### 📊 `Node 4: Save Trends to Sheet` **🔗 Type:** Google Sheets **🧩 What it does:** Takes the structured trend data and **appends it to a Google Sheet** for archiving, analysis, or sharing. * 🔄 Keeps data centralized in Google Drive * 🧾 Every entry becomes part of a monthly trend log * 📤 Can be exported, visualized, or emailed later > 💡 *Why it matters:* This gives you a **living database of viral content** that you can reference later for reports, content ideas, social strategy, or client insights. --- ### 📦 **Workflow Summary** | Section | What's Happening | Icons | | ------------------------------------ | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------- | | **🧠 Section 1**
Trigger & Scrape | Automatically triggers each month → sends request to scrape Quora via Bright Data | ⏰ 🌐 🔍 | | **🧾 Section 2**
Extract & Store | Parses HTML → extracts question titles, votes, links → saves to Google Sheets | 🧾 🧪 📊 | --- ### 💼 How a Beginner Can Use This 1. **No Code Needed:** All steps use visual nodes in n8n. 2. **Customizable Topics:** Change `"url"` in the HTTP node to track any niche. 3. **Scalable:** Duplicate the scraping node to include Reddit, Twitter, or LinkedIn later. 4. **Google Sheets Ready:** Easy to share or use in reporting tools like Looker Studio or Excel. ---

### 🧠 **SECTION 1: Trend Trigger & Scraper**

> **Purpose:** Automate the scraping of viral content from Quora every month.

#### ⏰ `Node 1: Monthly Trend Trigger`

**🔗 Type:** Cron Scheduler
**🧩 What it does:**
This node is like your personal assistant — it **automatically starts the workflow on the 1st day of every month** without you lifting a finger.

* 🗓 Trigger schedule: Monthly (e.g., `0 0 1 * *`)
* 📈 Use Case: Keeps your trend tracking consistent and timely

> 🧠 *Why it matters:* Instead of manually checking viral trends, this node ensures it’s **fully automated**, perfect for monthly reports or trend tracking dashboards.

---

#### 🌐 `Node 2: Scrape Quora Trends (Bright Data)`

**🔗 Type:** HTTP Request
**🧩 What it does:**
This node sends a **POST request to Bright Data** to scrape trending Quora results for a given topic (like `"https://www.quora.com/search?q=marketing"`).

* 🔒 Uses **Bright Data Web Unlocker** to bypass restrictions
* 🧠 Intelligent scraping with full HTML + rendering
* 🔍 Targets specific search terms (e.g., `marketing`, `UX`, `AI in marketing`)

> 💡 *Why it matters:* You can collect **real trending content** from Quora without opening your browser. Bright Data handles the hard stuff like JavaScript, proxies, and blocks.

---

### 🧾 **SECTION 2: Extract & Save Insights**

> **Purpose:** Process the scraped data and store it in a usable format (Google Sheets).

#### 🧱 `Node 3: Extract Post Titles & Stats`

**🔗 Type:** HTML Extract
**🧩 What it does:**
Takes the raw HTML from Quora and pulls out the meaningful information you care about:

* 📝 Question titles or post headlines
* 🔗 URLs
* 👍 Vote count or engagement
* 🧑 Author or answer snippet (if desired)

You use **CSS Selectors or XPath** to tell n8n what to extract. For example:

```css
a.q-box.qu-mb--tiny  →  Post links  
div.q-relative  →  Snippets or text  
```

> 🧠 *Why it matters:* This is where raw data becomes structured. You’re now transforming messy HTML into useful, clean trend info.

---

#### 📊 `Node 4: Save Trends to Sheet`

**🔗 Type:** Google Sheets
**🧩 What it does:**
Takes the structured trend data and **appends it to a Google Sheet** for archiving, analysis, or sharing.
